name: Fulham FC History Online Quiz | Fulham | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what year were the club formed?
questions.explanation:
1879.

	In 1879, Fulham St Andrews was born, and they dropped St Andrews from their name in 1888.

questions.text: Where did the club first play their home matches?
questions.explanation:
Star Road.

	Fulham played at Star Road between 1878-83, then moved on to Eel Brook Common, Lillie Road, Putney Lower Common, Ranelagh House, Barn Elms, Purser's Cross, Half Moon, Eel Brook Common (again), West Brompton, and Craven Cottage in 1895. They started groundsharing Loftus Road with Queens Park Rangers in 2002, awaiting Craven Cottage's refurbishment.

questions.text: Who was the club's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
Harry Bradshaw.

	Harry Bradshaw was manager between 1904-09, followed by Kelso (1909-24), Ducat (1924-26), and Joe Bradshaw between 1926-29.

questions.text: From which team did Fulham buy Edwin Van der Sar from in 2001?
questions.explanation:
Juventus.

	Dutchman Van der Sar began his career with Ajax Amsterdam in 1988, and transferred to Inter Milan in 1999, before signing for Jean Tigana and Fulham in 2001.

questions.text: Which of these played the most games for Fulham?
questions.explanation:
Johnny Haynes.

	Haynes played 594 games for Fulham between 1952-70.

questions.text: In which season did Fulham first play in the Football League?
questions.explanation:
1907-08.

	Fulham played in Division Two in this season, and finished fourth out of 20 teams, with 49 points from 38 games.

questions.text: Who did Fulham beat in the 1963-64 season, to set the record for their biggest League victory?
questions.explanation:
Ipswich Town.

	Fulham won the game 10-1 on 26th December, 1963. A Boxing Day, which Ipswich fans would rather forget!

questions.text: When Fulham were promoted in the 1998-99 season, they achieved something, which they then repeated in the 2000-01 promotion season. What was this extraordinary feat?
questions.correct: They scored 101 points in both seasons
options: They remained unbeaten throughout both seasons
They never lost away from home in both seasons
They won every game at home in both seasons
questions.explanation:
They scored 101 points in both seasons.

	In the 1998-99 Division Two season, Fulham were promoted, and only lost 7 games all season, and in the 2000-01 season, only lost 5 all season.

questions.text: Which of these players scored the most League goals in a season for the club?
questions.explanation:
Frank Newton.

	Newton scored 43 League goals, during the 1931-32 Division Threee (South) season.

questions.text: What was the score of the 1957-58 FA Cup semi-final replay, against Manchester United?
questions.explanation:
Fulham 3 Manchester United 5.

	Fulham became the first team to score three goals, in an FA Cup semi-final match and still lose, while Manchester United went on to lose the final 2-0, against Aston Villa.
